messages.content: What is the capital of France? Please explain your reasoning.

content.text:
The capital of France is Paris. This has been true since 508 CE when the Franks made Paris their capital. Paris has remained France's capital through various forms of government (monarchy, republic, empire) for over 1500 years.

There's no ambiguity or controversy about this fact. Paris is France's:
- Political capital (seat of government)
- Economic capital (largest city and business center)
- Cultural capital (major center for art, fashion, cuisine)
- Most populous city (over 2 million in city proper, 12 million in metro area)

The French government, including the President's residence (Élysée Palace) and National Assembly, is locate
